content.description: This is the right crack. Climb a hand crack, step right to wide crack, move right and chimney to the top.

This route starts with some thin-ish face climbing just right of Choss-o-saurus.  The crux is low and then you follow the quasi loose features and edges to the top.  Nuts can go in a horizontal for added protection if needed.
content.protection: 8 bolts lead to Mussy Hook anchors.  A few nuts will protect between the bolts.
content.location: This is the bolted line just right of Choss-o-saurus and left of the Center Dinosaur Crack.  Mussy Hooks at the top.

content.description: This is the widening hand crack on the left. Rap from slings.

This is the line of bolts just right of the Left Dinosaur Crack.  Crux is low on good rock and difficulty depends on whether you use the boulder right behind you as a feature.  The climbing soon eases and the semi loose but featured face above is fun climbing at about 5.7.
content.protection: Lots of bolts (9) but you might need a couple of cams between a few bolts.  Two or three total cams in the .75 to 3" range will get it done.  Mussy hooks at the top.
content.location: This route is the bolted line that is immediately right of the Left Dinosaur Crack.  It starts down in the pit with a back scraping boulder right behind you.  Mussy Hooks at the top.

content.description: This is the nice, left slanting (making it a little awkward) large-hand crack in the center.
content.protection:
Gear to 4" or larger. There are two bolts at top and mussies just to the left.

(Doubles in 1-3" would be nice, beware the book saying gear to 2".)

Don't forget, 70m rope needed or a single strand rappel to get down!
